channel.title: Project RandQm ~ A new rsps era. || FIRST STRESS-TEST PERFORMED
channel.description:
[center][size=24pt][b]Project RandQm[/b][/size] [size=14pt][i][b]~ Because a more unoriginal name wasn't possible ~[/b][/i][/size][/center]
[size=14pt][b]Intro[/b][/size] Project RandQm has been created of the absolute framework of LightRune by klept0. The original LightRune release already had some content which I removed to not create the feeling of 2 programming styles in one server. The absolute framework like networking, packetbuilding and a part of player updating has been kept. All the rest you will find in this server has been programmed by me from scratch, sometimes referenced to lightrune closer to the core code.
This is being created not only for personal learning purposes but as well in hopes of getting to move people from Delta and PI to this. I know many servers with this goal have passed by and only a few actually reach the goal. But if I only see one release based on this I already will be happy. And else I at least learned a lot from it.
Servers like Hyperion and Apollo are definitely a lot better than this project. One reason for that is that I simply do not have the skills of a Graham. 2nd I don't want to create a server that looks like Chinese for unexperienced programmers. With Project RandQm I aim to create a server with quality but at the same time staying user friendly. Somebody coming from PI should find the way in this server as much as somebody coming from Hyperion.
Of course this is not a ready-made server aimed to a particular group of programmers, e.g. PI-programmers, and inspecting code will still be required in able to work with this server.
[size=14pt][b]Latest stress-test results:[/b][/size] Today (30th of July) I performed the first stress test on Project RandQm I used the runerebels stresstester for this. NOTE: Due the lack of added packages, no actions were performed by the robots, therefore these are not accurate numbers. NOTE2: The reached amount of connections is the actual maximum connections allowed I had set for the server. Once I have my packets done I will do a new stress-test without connection limits and with performing actions. The CPU load was at the peak: 10% (i7 26300M 2.0GHZ) The RAM load was at the peak: 2.6GB The amount of active connections reached: 2998 2997 bots + myself as player
[img]http://i.imgur.com/FXHqzUn.png[/img]
[size=14pt][b]What is in this server?[/b][/size]
[ul][li]The base uses NIO networking, this is straight from LightRune.[/li] [li]Tried to document as much as possible of the code added.[/li] [li]Error logging system.[/li] [li]Kept code has been edited to fit the way I program.[/li] [li]Private messaging has been done and is fully functional.[/li] [li]The half-done original Lightrune playerupdating has been updated and finished.[/li] [li]All rs2 packets have been added and are fully functional.[/li] [li]Clipped player following has been added from the tutorial somewhere around here.[/li] [li]Appearance managing has been added and is fully working.[/li] [li]Death management has been done.[/li] [li]Logging has been updated and redone, (initializing, saving, loading)[/li] [li]Player management has been redone.[/li] [li]Bank managing has been added and is functional.[/li] [li]Equipment managing has been added and is functional.[/li] [li]Inventory managing has been added and is functional.[/li] [li]Ground items with global drop support.[/li] [li]Switching fully added and functional.[/li] [li]Npc system has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Npc updating has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Npc aggressivity has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Npc movement has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Npc clipping has been added and is acceptable, comes from the tutorial once released here.[/li] [li]Npc communications has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Npc animations have been added and are fully functional.[/li] [li]Npc death managing has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Object management has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Object updating for visibility by other players has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Leveling control has been added and is fully functional.[/li] [li]Flaggingsystem for banning etc...[/li] [li]Basic feutures like walking, commands, etc...[/li][/ul]
[size=14pt][b]Some quick taken media:[/b][/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/lByaiMU.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/B5HK52x.gif[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/02fQC0B.png[/img]
[s][size=14pt][b]Stuff that isn't planned to be done on release.[/b][/size] Combat wont be added yet in this release, though hitupdates etc... are working. so it's just a combat system for both players and npc's that should be added. Maybe I will release a version with combat, but at this point I do not have the time to do this. So feel free to rerealease this base with combat, once it has been released.[/s]
[size=13pt][b]End-Note:[/b][/size] I know all my last projects went ended in nothing, and that's the reason why I didn't post this development earlier, though I've been working on it for some time. The biggest part of my goals is already finished at this point and I don't doubt that I will finish this.
[size=13pt][b]Credits:[/b][/size] Me klept0

item.title: Project RandQm ~ A new rsps era. || FIRST STRESS-TEST PERFORMED
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Had to perform some fixes on npc’s.
But they are now fully done with walking, communication, basic combat, animations, updating and aggressivity.

Started working on leveling, skills can be refreshed now and starting values are working:
Leveling should be finished very soon.

A check if it’s the player’s first login as well as support for a starter pack have been added.

yLobFdv.png781×541

Read full topic
item.source: Project RandQm ~ A new rsps era. || FIRST STRESS-TEST PERFORMED

Good luck, babe. I have faith in you. <3

item.title: Project RandQm ~ A new rsps era. || FIRST STRESS-TEST PERFORMED
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[size=14pt]Recent updates:[/size]

  • An entity system has been added (entity ->player,npc)
  • Death-managing has been re-added to get rid of the 2 separate classes for players and npcs since we have a better entity tree now.
  • A basic combat system has been added based on the new entity tree.
  • Mp3 player has been added which you can find in server tutorials.

Stress test performed which you can find the results off at the top of the thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Project RandQm ~ A new rsps era. || FIRST STRESS-TEST PERFORMED
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[center][size=24pt]Project RandQm[/size]
[size=14pt]~ Because a more unoriginal name wasn’t possible ~[/size][/center]

[size=14pt]Intro[/size]
Project RandQm has been created of the absolute framework of LightRune by klept0.
The original LightRune release already had some content which I removed to not create the feeling
of 2 programming styles in one server.
The absolute framework like networking, packetbuilding and a part of player updating has been kept.
All the rest you will find in this server has been programmed by me from scratch,
sometimes referenced to lightrune closer to the core code.

This is being created not only for personal learning purposes but as well in hopes of
getting to move people from Delta and PI to this. I know many servers with this goal have
passed by and only a few actually reach the goal. But if I only see one release based on this
I already will be happy. And else I at least learned a lot from it.

Servers like Hyperion and Apollo are definitely a lot better than this project.
One reason for that is that I simply do not have the skills of a Graham.
2nd I don’t want to create a server that looks like Chinese for unexperienced programmers.
With Project RandQm I aim to create a server with quality but at the same time staying user friendly.
Somebody coming from PI should find the way in this server as much as somebody coming from Hyperion.

Of course this is not a ready-made server aimed to a particular group of programmers, e.g. PI-programmers,
and inspecting code will still be required in able to work with this server.

[size=14pt]Latest stress-test results:[/size]
Today (30th of July) I performed the first stress test on Project RandQm
I used the runerebels stresstester for this.
NOTE: Due the lack of added packages, no actions were performed by the robots, therefore these are not accurate numbers.
NOTE2: The reached amount of connections is the actual maximum connections allowed I had set for the server.
Once I have my packets done I will do a new stress-test without connection limits and with performing actions.
The CPU load was at the peak: 10% (i7 26300M 2.0GHZ)
The RAM load was at the peak: 2.6GB
The amount of active connections reached: 2998
2997 bots + myself as player

[size=14pt]What is in this server?[/size]

[ul][li]The base uses NIO networking, this is straight from LightRune.[/li]
[li]Tried to document as much as possible of the code added.[/li]
[li]Error logging system.[/li]
[li]Kept code has been edited to fit the way I program.[/li]
[li]Private messaging has been done and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]The half-done original Lightrune playerupdating has been updated and finished.[/li]
[li]All rs2 packets have been added and are fully functional.[/li]
[li]Clipped player following has been added from the tutorial somewhere around here.[/li]
[li]Appearance managing has been added and is fully working.[/li]
[li]Death management has been done.[/li]
[li]Logging has been updated and redone, (initializing, saving, loading)[/li]
[li]Player management has been redone.[/li]
[li]Bank managing has been added and is functional.[/li]
[li]Equipment managing has been added and is functional.[/li]
[li]Inventory managing has been added and is functional.[/li]
[li]Ground items with global drop support.[/li]
[li]Switching fully added and functional.[/li]
[li]Npc system has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Npc updating has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Npc aggressivity has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Npc movement has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Npc clipping has been added and is acceptable, comes from the tutorial once released here.[/li]
[li]Npc communications has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Npc animations have been added and are fully functional.[/li]
[li]Npc death managing has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Object management has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Object updating for visibility by other players has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Leveling control has been added and is fully functional.[/li]
[li]Flaggingsystem for banning etc…[/li]
[li]Basic feutures like walking, commands, etc…[/li][/ul]

[size=14pt]Some quick taken media:[/size]

02fQC0B.png781×541

[size=14pt]Stuff that isn’t planned to be done on release.[/size]
Combat wont be added yet in this release, though hitupdates etc… are working.
so it’s just a combat system for both players and npc’s that should be added.
Maybe I will release a version with combat, but at this point I do not have the time
to do this. So feel free to rerealease this base with combat, once it has been released.

[size=13pt]End-Note:[/size]
I know all my last projects went ended in nothing, and that’s the reason why I didn’t post this development earlier,
though I’ve been working on it for some time. The biggest part of my goals is already finished at this point and I don’t doubt
that I will finish this.

[size=13pt]Credits:[/size]
Me
klept0

Read full topic
